newsitem.title: UK: ZENECA, GLAXO BOUNCE, DKB SAYS SWITCH.
newsitem.headline: ZENECA, GLAXO BOUNCE, DKB SAYS SWITCH.

text.p: Shares in British drug firm Zeneca Group Plc rose 24p to 1,910-1/2p, bouncing after a steep fall on Wednesday and as Dresdner Kleinwort Benson advised switching into the stock from Glaxo Wellcome Plc.
Despite the switch advice, Glaxo recovered by 13p to 1,239p after falling 49p on Wednesday when Zeneca fell 60p and SmithKline 13-1/2p.

"We reiterated our advice. Zeneca is our preference in the UK. The price has been depressed after encouraging interim results and we think it is a good long-term situation so we've given it a nudge," said DKB analyst Steve Putnam.
A million Zeneca shares traded by mid-morning and 1.5 million Glaxo shares changed hands.

SmithKline Beecham Plc eased 5-1/2p to 1,332-1/2p with nearly two million shares traded. Analysts said SmithKline tends to move more in line with trends in U.S. drug shares than the other two big UK pharmaceutical firms. U.S. drug stock declined in the last few days, they said.
